column5: Hear lots of questions regarding bringing fish back to the US however I'm meeting someone up near Sudbury and wanted to treat him to some of the Jumbo Perch I've been catching lately here at home. Any special rules apply to bringing fish into Ontario? Fresh, but frozen solid as a rock right now. Any thoughts I should concern myself with? Thanks.
I would leave them at home. That's a pretty gray area.

I was thinking that's like bringing milk to the convenience store!! Really, though, why would it be any different that bringing venison? So long as you have a license from the states to cover them, and they're able to be identified and counted, and legal-like for transport within your home state, I'd do it. Frozen 40 fillets in a block??? Mmmm, not so much.

I don't know if there are any special rules, but if brought to the authorities attention (one way or whatever), you would probably be in for some lengthy explaining. You maybe want to weigh the advantages of bringing in vs the possibly of an agonizing amount of hours you may have to spend explaining your attempt to do your friend a favor. And then maybe have to pay a fine. All officers also may not see your generous offer in a like manner, which could be good or bad, etc. Vs venison - probably would not be bringing in half of a deer. Bill
What about overnighting the catch? Not sure where you are headed, but there must be a way if it's that important to you?
